action.action-desc: Mr. Southerland introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, to exempt agricultural loads traveling on Federal highways if State agricultural regulations are met.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Right to Haul Act of 2014.

subsection.text: Section 127 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding subsection (a), individual State weight limitations for an agricultural commodity that are applicable to State highways shall be applicable to the Interstate System within the Stateâ€™s borders for vehicles carrying an agricultural commodity.

The term agricultural commodity means any agricultural commodity (including horticulture, aquaculture, and floriculture), food, feed, fiber, forestry products, livestock (including elk, reindeer, bison, horses, or deer), or insects, and any product thereof.
